intro: Schizoglossum tenue, commonly known as the slender false hellebore, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typically blooming in late spring. Schizoglossum tenue is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
